industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
Energy Impact Partners LP (EIP) is a global investment firm leading the transition to a sustainable future. EIP brings together entrepreneurs and some of the world's most forward-looking energy and industrial companies to advance innovation. With over $4 billion in assets under management, EIP invests globally across venture, growth and credit - and has a team of over 90 professionals based in its offices in New York, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Atlanta, Palm Beach, London, Cologne, Oslo and Singapore.
We're seeking an Analyst to join our Customer Experience practice, helping to bridge EIP's investment teams and limited partners (LPs). This role will provide support across a variety of focus areas and across all of EIP's many funds, from large LP events to critical reporting needs and everything in between. 
This is an opportunity to work on a high-visibility team in an established firm driving innovation across the entirety of the energy ecosystem. We're looking for a driven process-minded individual, who can balance competing workstreams and provide an exceptional limited partner experience and help propel EIP to new heights. 
Key Areas of Responsibility:
Provide project management support for quarterly deliverables, including quarterly account planning and quarterly business reviews 
Plan, support, execute, and conduct follow ups in conjunction with firm events for limited partners, both virtual and in person
Update and maintain limited partner collateral, including fund reports 
Support the onboarding of new limited partners and ambassadors
Maintain quarterly strategic content calendar
Manage and refine customer datasets across different funds
Act as point of contact for limited partners for any EIP fund updates and events, both preceding and following
Support the onboarding of new limited partners and ambassadors
Ongoing dashboard and pipeline maintenance to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Requirements
The Ideal Candidate Will Have:
Bachelor's degree
Prior experience, or demonstrated interest in, the energy or climate tech sector
Excellent analytical skills and capability 
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to juggle multiple competing priorities in fast paced environment 
An independent mindset and intellectual curiosity
A track record of working effectively on a team and being a good teammate
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 
Benefits
The compensation range for this role is $85,000-$100,000 plus discretionary bonus.
